May it please yo
r
good L. for my letters,
I never sent any, sins I came hither, by any
messenger of purpose, but it was for some ma-
ter that required expedition, and then I have
specified in my letter, that I sent him of pur-
pose. Others come unto me to offer their service,
being bound to goe for
England,
for their
privat occasions: and I have warned many
suche, not to looke for allowance, as I will
doe
it
heereafter more precisely. I could consigne
my letters to some of
Middlebourgh
or
Flushing,
but by passing many handes they would be
longer in conveing, and more in danger
of miscarieng. For whiche I send, when I
can, by suche as promise me heere, to goe di-
rectly for
e Court: but by no man expressly,
unles I signifie so muche.
